terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to view previous versions and see who made specific changes.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing transparency and accountability.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and share documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A software platform that stores, organizes, tracks, and manages digital documents and files in a centralized location.
A single, unified location where all related documents, data, and resources are stored and can be accessed by authorized users.
Written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand technical products, processes, or systems.
The coordination and automation of business processes and tasks to ensure efficient completion and proper sequencing of activities.
A pre-designed document format or structure that can be reused and customized for creating consistent documentation.
The graphical representation of information and data using charts, graphs, and other visual elements to make complex data easier to understand.
A system for recording, monitoring, and managing problems, bugs, or tasks throughout their lifecycle from identification to resolution.
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as engineering, design, and quality assurance teams.
Research and Development - systematic activities that combine basic and applied research to discover new knowledge and develop new products or processes.
The process of monitoring and documenting adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies.
